arts.ttl: Conte: Not sure Napoli deserve to top Serie A
arts.sum: Napoli manager Antonio Conte is cautiously optimistic about the team's form and said they were improving after a comfortable win over Como on Friday extended their lead at the top of Serie A.

arts.ttl: Como manager Fabregas praises Napoli’s Lobotka after defeat
arts.sum: Despite suffering a 3-1 loss to Napoli, Como manager Cesc Fabregas found positives in his team’s performance and had high praise for Napoli midfielder Stanislav Lobotka. In a post-match interview, Fabregas shared his thoughts on the game and his admiration for certain players. Fabregas began by expressing his disappointment with the result but pride in his team’s effort: “I’m not satisfied because we lost and we wanted to come here to win. I certainly made mistakes, but I really liked the courage. This is our identity, our style of play. I’m proud of the first 60 minutes we played.” The The post Como manager Fabregas praises Napoli’s Lobotka after defeat appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Napoli’s Scott McTominay after scoring against Como: “Need to win as many games as possible”
arts.sum: Serie A giants Napoli continued their impressive run of form in the league and beat Como 3-1 in Naples. Scott McTominay was on the scoresheet in the league for the…

arts.ttl: Serie A | Napoli 3-1 Como: Match Report
arts.sum: Napoli continued their impressive run in Serie A, securing a convincing 3-1 victory against Como to maintain their position at the top of the league table. The match began with an electrifying moment as Scott McTominay found the back of the net just 25 seconds after kickoff. The midfielder expertly converted an assist from Romelu Lukaku, maneuvering into the box and slotting the ball in off the left post to give Napoli an early advantage. Despite falling behind, Como demonstrated impressive form throughout the first half. Nico Paz emerged as a constant threat, coming close to equalizing on multiple occasions. The post Serie A | Napoli 3-1 Como: Match Report appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Napoli Player Ratings vs Como: Lukaku Unplayable, Khvicha Lackluster
arts.sum: High-flying Napoli maintained their renaissance under Antonio Conte with an enthralling 3-1 home win against Serie A newcomers Como. Though the scoreline could suggest the Partenopei eased past their visitors, it wasn't the case in a dramatic contest at Stadio Diego Armando Maradona. The post Napoli Player Ratings vs Como: Lukaku Unplayable, Khvicha Lackluster appeared first on The Cult of Calcio.

arts.ttl: Scott McTominay opens the scoring after just 25 SECONDS for Napoli against Como as former Man United midfielder continues to impress in Italy
arts.sum: After receiving the ball from former Manchester United team-mate Romelu Lukaku, McTominay showed impressive control before finishing well.

arts.ttl: Napoli director Manna: ‘We’re talking to Kvara about contract renewal, but there’s no rush’
arts.sum: Napoli sporting director Giovanni Manna has provided an update on the contract situation of star winger Khvicha Kvaratskhelia. Speaking to the media before Napoli’s match against Como, Manna emphasized that there is no rush to finalize a new deal with the Georgian international. “The situation with Kvara is very clear: he has three years left on his contract. We are talking, but we have no stress at this moment. We are focused on many other things. We will calmly discuss with him and his agent, but without anxiety,” Manna explained.
